docs.snippet: Just in the past seven years, the Hells Angels have brought more than a dozen cases in federal court, alleging infringement for borrowing the motorcycle club’s name and insignias....
docs.lead_paragraph: Just in the past seven years, the Hells Angels have brought more than a dozen cases in federal court, alleging infringement for borrowing the motorcycle club’s name and insignias.
docs.abstract: Hells Angels, despite tough outsider image, have become surprisingly litigious organization, bringing more than a dozen intellectual property cases in federal court in past seven years; group has developed highly lucrative brand, and has brought suits for trademark infringement on apparel, jewelery and host of other items.

headline.main: Despite Outlaw Image, Hells Angels Sue Often
headline.print_headline: Despite Outlaw Image, Hells Angels Sue Often

keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Sheelagh McNeill and Jack Begg contributed research.
